title: Efficacy and safety of mRNA COVID-19 vaccines in immunocompromised patients: a systematic review and meta-analysis
abstract: Background: Immunocompromised patients have reduced immune responses to vaccines and increased risk of severe COVID-19. We assessed the efficacy and safety of mRNA COVID-19 vaccines in this population. Methods: We conducted a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials and observational studies. Results: mRNA vaccines demonstrated reduced but significant immunogenicity in immunocompromised patients with acceptable safety profiles.

title: Machine learning approaches for early detection of sepsis in the intensive care unit
abstract: Objective: To develop and validate machine learning models for early sepsis detection using electronic health record data from ICU patients. Design: Retrospective cohort study using data from multiple ICUs. Results: Random forest and gradient boosting models achieved superior performance compared to traditional scoring systems with AUROC of 0.92 and 0.94, respectively.

title: CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing for treating inherited retinal diseases: current progress and future directions
abstract: Inherited retinal diseases (IRDs) are a leading cause of blindness worldwide. CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing offers promising therapeutic potential for treating these conditions. This review summarizes current clinical trials, discusses delivery challenges, and outlines future research directions for gene editing therapies in ophthalmology.

title: Precision medicine in oncology: biomarkers and targeted therapies
journal: Advances in Cancer Treatment and Research
abstract: This chapter explores the role of precision medicine in modern oncology, focusing on the identification and clinical application of biomarkers for targeted cancer therapies. We discuss current FDA-approved targeted treatments, companion diagnostics, and emerging therapeutic approaches including CAR-T cell therapy and immunotherapy combinations.

title: Artificial intelligence in medical imaging: improving diagnostic accuracy for diabetic retinopathy
journal: Proceedings of the International Conference on Medical Imaging and AI
abstract: We present a deep learning model for automated detection of diabetic retinopathy from fundus photographs. Our convolutional neural network achieved 94.2% sensitivity and 95.8% specificity on a dataset of 50,000 retinal images, demonstrating superior performance compared to general ophthalmologists and approaching specialist-level accuracy.

title: Clinical Guidelines for Pediatric Emergency Medicine: Evidence-Based Approaches
abstract: This comprehensive handbook provides evidence-based clinical guidelines for pediatric emergency medicine practitioners. Covering common and critical conditions in children, the book includes diagnostic algorithms, treatment protocols, and age-specific considerations for emergency care. Each chapter is supported by the latest research and clinical evidence.
